author: Amit Mudgill
title: BSE IPO: BSE creates history! Exchange lists at Rs 1,085, 34.62% premium over issue price
text:
NEW DELHI: BSE created history on Friday, with its shares getting listed on rival NSE at Rs 1,085, a 34.62 per cent premium over its issue price of Rs 806. 

At 10.02 am, the stock was trading 40.19 per cent higher at Rs 1,130. This was the first-ever listing of a stock exchange. 

Analysts were expecting the BSE stock to list at a premium of 5-15 per cent, as the stock was commanding over 20 per cent premium to the issue price in the grey market on Thursday. 

MCX was the first commodity exchange to list on stock exchanges on March 9, 2012. 

The first IPO of 2017, which was sold in Rs 805-806 price band, had received a massive 51 times subscription during the bidding period January 23-25. 

BSE, which operates in three segments, is India’s largest and world’s tenth largest exchange by market capitalisation. The securities services business on the exchange derives about 57 per cent of its revenues, followed by services to corporate and data dissemination fees which accounts for 38 per cent and 5 per cent of the bourse’s revenues. 

As on June 30, 2016, BSE had 1,440 unique members across all segments. In FY16, average of 284.92 million orders and nearly 1.55 million trades in equity shares/trading day made BSE the world’s twelfth most active exchange. 

Brokerage Nirmal Bang Securities in a report said that lagging behind in adoption of derivatives hurt BSE, which lost dominant position in the domestic market to NSE in cash segment as well. 


“Now BSE is trying to strike first in many of the newer products like currency derivative, MFs, debt market, International Exchange etc. We feel the success of any of the activity can bring growth for BSE,” it said. 

The exchange, meanwhile, is preparing IPO for its arm CDSL. The exchange is required to cut its stake in CDSL from current 52 per cent as per Sebi directive. BSE’s holdings in CDSL and Clearing Corporation, is seen as value accretive.
